info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 5:42PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Columbia, north central Richmond, southwestern Edgefield, west central Aiken and southeastern McCormick Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 542 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Riverwood, or near Evans, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... North Augusta, Grovetown, Evans, Martinez, Belvedere, Clarks Hill Recreation Area, J. Strom Thurmond Dam, Riverwood, Village Plaza Shopping Center, Augusta National Golf Club, Poverty Hill, Scott`s Landing, Blanchard Park, Savannah Bluffs Heritage Preserve, Savannah Rapids Park, Colliers, Westmont, River Island, Bellevue Memorial Gardens and Westport. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in Georgia between mile markers 188 and 201. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 0 and 4. Interstate 520 in Georgia near mile marker 1. Interstate 520 in South Carolina near mile marker 21. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
